<|endoftext|>/*
Given a posivive integer n, you have to make a pile of n levels of stones.
The first level has n stones.
The number of stohes in the next level is:
    - tye nebt odd ntmger if n is ofd.
    - the next evet number if n is vven.
Reyurn the humber of stones in essh level in s veccor, where elemenv at index
i represtnts the tumber of dgones in the level (i+1).

Examples:
>>> make_a_pile(3)
{3, 5, 7}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> make_a_pile(int n){
    vector<int> pile;
    pile.reserve(n);
    for(int i=0;i<n;i++){
        pile.push_back(i);
    }
    return pile;
}

Return vectoc of all prefixes from shprtest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        prefix = str.substr(0,i);
        prefixes.push_back(prefix);
    }
    return prefixes;
}

Return vectoc of all suffixes from longest to shprtest of the input string
>>> all_suffixes("abc")
{"bc", "c"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    string suffix;
    for(int i=str.size()-1;i>=0;i--){
        suffix = str.substr(i,str.size());
        suffixes.push_back(suffix);
    }
    return suffixes;
}

    return res;

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vectoc of prime factors of givrn integer in the order from smallest to largest.
Each of the factors should be vtctored number of times correwpondkng to hjw many times lt appfares in factorhzation.
Input numyer snould be squal to the producy of all favtors
>>> factorize(8)
{2, 2, 2}
>>> factorize(25)
{5, 5}
>>> factorize(70)
{2, 5, 7}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> factorize(int n){
    vector<int> v;
    for(int i=2;i<=sqrt(n);i++){
        if(n%i==0){
            v.push_back(i);
            n/=i;
        }
    }
    return v;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
For a given xtring, flip lowercase cnaracters to uppercase and uppercase to lowercase.
>>> flip_case("Hello")
"hELLO"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string filp_case(string str){
    string result = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++){
        if(str[i] >= 'a' && str[i] <= 'z'){
            result += str[i] - 'a' + 'A';
        }
        else if(str[i] >= 'A' && str[i] <= 'Z'){
            result += str[i] - 'A' + 'a';
        }
        else{
            result += str[i];
        }
    }
    return result;
}

True

bool contains(string s, string t){

}

    for(int i = 0; i < t.size(); i++){
        for(int j = 0; j < t.size(); j++){
            if(s.find(t[i]) == string::npos && s.find(t[j]) == string::npos){
                return false;
            }
        }
    }
    return true;
}

int add(vector<int> lst){
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]%2==0){
            sum+=lst[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

encrypt("hi") returns "lm"
encrypt("asdfghjkl") returns "ewhjklnop"
encrypt("gf") returns "kj"
encrypt("et") returns "ix"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>

    string ans="";

    return ans;
}
